intro: Hieracium zinserlingianum, commonly known as the Zinserling's hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to central and eastern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. It produces yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are usually hairy and arranged in a rosette pattern, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
